2022-04-24T14:54:40Z: That's all from us today - thanks for joining us, and we'll see you all for the Miami Grand Prix in two weeks' time! Enjoy the rest of your day.
2022-04-24T14:53:19Z: Here's the report from a damp/dry Emilia Romagna GP: https://www.autosport.com/f1/news/f1-emilia-romagna-gp-verstappen-leads-red-bull-1-2-leclerc-spin-loses-podium/10179437/
2022-04-24T14:38:39Z: Ocon cops a five-second penalty, bringing Alex Albon up to 11th, with Gasly and Hamilton classified 12th and 13th.
2022-04-24T14:37:30Z: Yuki Tsunoda bags a rather tasty seventh, ahead of Vettel - who picks up Aston Martin's first points of the year - Magnussen and Stroll.
2022-04-24T14:36:48Z: Russell holds off Bottas for fourth, with Leclerc rescuing sixth after his Variante Alta excursion.
2022-04-24T14:36:17Z: Sergio Perez locks out a Red Bull 1-2, as Lando Norris completes the podium!
2022-04-24T14:35:55Z: And Max Verstappen wins the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix at an absolute canter!
2022-04-24T14:34:51Z: Leclerc duly gets by Tsunoda to move up to sixth place. He's limited the damage a little but it is still a costly spin for the Ferrari driver given the circumstances.
2022-04-24T14:34:48Z: Verstappen reports a few drops of rain, but he's coming up to take the final lap of the race.
2022-04-24T14:33:49Z: Leclerc is within a second behind Tsunoda at the start of the penultimate lap.
2022-04-24T14:33:42Z: Bottas is within touching distance of Russell, but Russell is just keeping his car in the middle for Tamburello and warding off any assaults from Bottas.
2022-04-24T14:30:59Z: Leclerc takes seventh place off Vettel on lap 60 using DRS into the first chicane. He's got three laps to catch Tsunoda who is 3.8s up the road.
2022-04-24T14:29:28Z: Leclerc is lapping two seconds per lap faster than Vettel so he should grab that place back.
2022-04-24T14:27:07Z: Bottas is now within DRS range of Russell - this is the battle for fourth. Can the Alfa Romeo driver make his way past his old team?
2022-04-24T14:26:55Z: At the start of lap 56 Leclerc uses DRS to charge by Magnussen into eighth place. He's now five seconds behind Vettel in seventh with six laps to go.
2022-04-24T14:25:41Z: Leclerc is back in the race in ninth place after his pitstop for a new front wing and right behind Magnussen.
2022-04-24T14:24:42Z: Norris inherits third place, as Bottas is continuing to close in behind Russell and now sits within 1.5s of the Mercedes!
2022-04-24T14:24:00Z: That's new softs and a new front wing for Leclerc, and he comes out behind Tsunoda and Vettel! Disaster!
2022-04-24T14:23:51Z: Tsunoda, gaining a place from Leclerc when he is in the pits, also gets by Vettel with the aid of DRS to move up to sixth place.
2022-04-24T14:23:21Z: Leclerc spins off at the Variante Alfa! Norris has trickled past Leclerc, and the Ferrari driver will have to come in again!
2022-04-24T14:22:15Z: Leclerc has a run on Perez with DRS at the start of lap 53, but the Ferrari driver doesn't quite have the pace to close in.
2022-04-24T14:20:57Z: The pitstop show has added some late intrigue into this race but further back it is as you were, with Hamilton still stuck right behind Gasly.
2022-04-24T14:19:56Z: Meanwhile, Leclerc streaks past Norris at the start of lap 51, putting him back behind Perez. Verstappen also pits for the red-walled tyre.
2022-04-24T14:19:08Z: Red Bull responds, as Perez calls into the pits! Probably a sensible call, as he takes the softs too.
2022-04-24T14:18:17Z: Leclerc comes in for a pit stop! Soft tyres for the Ferrari driver, losing a place to Lando Norris, as he tries to get his tyres warmed up.
2022-04-24T14:17:01Z: Bottas is now within four seconds of Russell now, and is continuing to find time over the Mercedes driver.
2022-04-24T14:14:30Z: An overtake! We almost forgot what one of those looks like! Tsunoda, with DRS, drives around the outside of Magnussen on the main straight to take eighth place.
2022-04-24T14:13:08Z: Bottas is slowly chipping away at Russell's P5, and is nearly within 5s of the Mercedes. Norris is keeping the gap over Russell - around 8s - relatively static.
2022-04-24T14:13:00Z: Hamilton is doing everything he can for a way past Gasly but the French driver is holding firm. On consecutive laps Hamilton pulls to the outside of Gasly at Tamburello but can't close the ground enough to make the move stick.
2022-04-24T14:10:47Z: A metal ring the size of an apple has popped off Latifi's Williams and landed on the track and on the racing line. Latifi is still running without trouble but that could some debris trouble if anyone runs over it.
2022-04-24T14:08:23Z: Even with DRS enabled this race is rather drifting by over the middle third with all the gaps fairly stable across the running order.
2022-04-24T14:07:51Z: Verstappen, after clearing some traffic, logs a 1m20.224s to re-open that lead to Perez - which fell to a very treacherous 11.7s. So close.
2022-04-24T14:05:52Z: Hamilton duly obliges on the main straight and lets Verstappen lap him, keeping tucked up behind him looking to pounce when Gasly also has to let the Red Bull by.
2022-04-24T14:04:08Z: Hamilton has been shown the blue flags, meaning he is about to be lapped by Verstappen.
2022-04-24T14:01:49Z: Verstappen is now 12.5s clear of Perez; he's at the checkout now. But will he face an unexpected item in the bagging area? It's not looking like it at this stage.
2022-04-24T14:01:19Z: A few more laps tick by and it is a bit of a repeat. Gasly gets DRS from Albon, Hamilton gets DRS from Gasly and the train trundles on.
2022-04-24T13:58:38Z: DRS giveth, DRS taketh away. Hamilton gets the DRS chasing Gasly but the AlphaTauri driver gets the same following Albon so it cancels each other out.
2022-04-24T13:57:56Z: The problem is, the field is pretty spaced out at this stage, so the drivers will have to push on to get a DRS boost.
2022-04-24T13:56:51Z: DRS enabled! Now then, let's see how this shakes things up.
2022-04-24T13:55:59Z: Hamilton is all over the rear of Gasly but cannot find a way ahead or the top speed on the straights to pull alongside and clear. It means he's still stuck in 14th place and is set to be the next driver to be lapped by Verstappen.
2022-04-24T13:53:57Z: It's a 1m20.587s for Verstappen now, he's cruising at the moment as we approach half-distance.
2022-04-24T13:53:46Z: Ricciardo pits again, swapping his mediums for hards on lap 32,  and cycles back to 18th place.
2022-04-24T13:52:34Z: It does seem a cautious move not to enable the DRS at this stage of the race, with all cars on dry tyres and a clear dry line around the entire track.
2022-04-24T13:50:32Z: That's allowed Verstappen to set two consecutive times in the 1m20s, meaning he's now nearly 10s up the road from Perez and Leclerc.
2022-04-24T13:49:40Z: Schumacher has been shown the black and white flag for track limits - one more trip over the white lines and he'll face consequences.
2022-04-24T13:49:33Z: Leclerc just hacked a full second out of Perez after the Mexican had a moment at the Variante Alta chicane, but Leclerc just can't find a way through at the start of lap 29 as Perez holds the centre of the circuit.
2022-04-24T13:47:29Z: Verstappen responds to the closing Perez with a 1m21.095s, but both Perez and Leclerc post 1m21.1s times - so the top three could end up being close if this continues.
2022-04-24T13:47:13Z: Tsunoda is the cork in a long midfield bottle, as Stroll looks for a way around the outside into Rivazza but gets hung out to dry and has to stay behind in 10th. There is still no DRS allowed in this race.
2022-04-24T13:45:20Z: Schumacher is having a race to forget, he runs over the grass at the Variante Alta chicane and his dry tyres cannot handle the wet grass and he spins around. The Haas driver is able to get going again but drops to last place behind Zhou.
2022-04-24T13:44:20Z: Perez now posts a 1m21.877s, shaking off Leclerc for now and closing the gap to Verstappen, which now stands at seven seconds.
2022-04-24T13:42:41Z: Hamilton was the biggest loser in that pitstop shake-up, dropping back to 14th place and losing three places, while Ricciardo was able to leap from 18th to 15th.
2022-04-24T13:42:24Z: Perez hence picks up the pace on the 23rd lap, opening the gap up to 0.8s seconds at the line to set a 1m22.583s - our fastest lap so far.
2022-04-24T13:41:14Z: Leclerc carries a lot of speed into the Variante Alta chicane, and gets right behind Perez down for the straight! But Leclerc doesn't quite have enough on the exit to mount an assault on the Red Bull.
2022-04-24T13:40:41Z: Ocon has been given a five-second penalty for an unsafe release in that pitstop near-miss. Ocon is currently running in 11th place with Albon, Gasly, Hamilton and Ricciardo right behind him.
2022-04-24T13:39:07Z: Leclerc goes a full second quicker than the Red Bull duo, posting a 1m24.435s! He's right on Perez's tail once more.
2022-04-24T13:38:24Z: Bottas had a slow stop, but still emerges ahead of Magnussen in sixth. The status quo among the top six hence remains.
2022-04-24T13:38:19Z: A pitstop incident involving Ocon and Hamilton is under investigation, it looks like Alpine released their driver right in the path of Hamilton and they came very close to clashing.
2022-04-24T13:37:20Z: Leclerc comes out on track ahead of Perez, but the Red Bull has a lap warmer tyres and clears the Ferrari at the Villeneuve chicane!
2022-04-24T13:36:24Z: Chaos in the pitlane as the midfield comes in together which has totally shaken things up. Hamilton has lost places to Ocon, Gasly and Albon in a slow stop.
2022-04-24T13:35:47Z: Verstappen and Leclerc begin lap 20 by coming into the pits, as does Norris!
2022-04-24T13:34:56Z: Ricciardo is setting purple sector times already on those medium tyres so it is definitely the time to pit.
2022-04-24T13:34:25Z: More slick moves at the front: Perez comes in from second, just as Leclerc has reeled him in! Russell and Bottas also come in to make the switch.
2022-04-24T13:33:40Z: Here's a few more dry tyre gamblers as Vettel, Gasly and Albon all come in for a pitstop a lap after Ricciardo.
2022-04-24T13:32:31Z: Ricciardo is the first to pit for dry tyres, opting for the medium tyres. He has nothing to lose running in 18th place and last. His pace will be the key test for the rest to do the same.
2022-04-24T13:30:29Z: As the Stroll vs Hamilton battle rages on for 10th, both drivers are gaining on Tsunoda ahead. That's not a sentence you'd have expected before this season.
2022-04-24T13:28:44Z: Further back Zhou has got ahead of Schumacher to take 16th place. The Alfa Romeo driver started from the pitlane, remember.
2022-04-24T13:28:41Z: Reports of rain coming at some point, but there's a very clear dry line. Is it worth a slick gamble at this stage? The teams might have to nominate a sacrificial lamb...
2022-04-24T13:27:16Z: Bottas now takes a great exit out of Variante Alta, and threads his Alfa Romeo past Magnussen at Rivazza. He's up to P6 now, as Magnussen goes in search of a wet line.
2022-04-24T13:26:25Z: Bottas is now on Magnussen's tail at the start of lap 13, but the Haas driver covers him off into Turn 1. Meanwhile, Leclerc's now within 2s of Perez, lapping faster than both Red Bulls.
2022-04-24T13:25:14Z: The Magnussen/Russell battle has brought Bottas into play now, a year on from the latter duo's...skirmish last year. But Russell stuffs it past at the Variante Alta, and clears Magnussen!
2022-04-24T13:24:23Z: Russell tries to find a way past at Piratella, but there's not the space to thread his Mercedes down the inside. But he's much closer as he begins his 12th lap, and sweeps around the outside - but clatters across the kerb to let Magnussen back through!
2022-04-24T13:22:53Z: Russell is very close to Magnussen now, following the Dane through Rivazza. He follows down the straight to kick off lap 11, but Magnussen places his car perfectly to keep Russell at bay into Turn 1.
2022-04-24T13:22:47Z: The debate about DRS now being too powerful has come up following the sprint race, so this period of no DRS racing provides a useful example of life without it. Not many overtakes yet.
2022-04-24T13:20:45Z: It's now a 1m29.917s for Verstappen, as Leclerc is reeling Perez in now. Meanwhile, Russell is chasing Magnussen for fifth.
2022-04-24T13:20:39Z: The midfield gaps have stabilised after that frantic start and while Hamilton is in DRS range of Stroll in 10th the DRS hasn't been enabled due to the wet conditions.
2022-04-24T13:18:20Z: Verstappen's building a break at the front, setting a 1m30.119s, as Leclerc streaks past Norris into the Tamburello at the start of lap 8 to grab third. Perez is next on his agenda.
2022-04-24T13:16:37Z: We'd guess Alonso's damage was picked up in his contact with Schumacher on the opening lap, and then the bodywork on the sidepod gave way just as Hamilton got by him. Alonso pits at the end of lap six and that's his race run.
2022-04-24T13:15:18Z: It has been a disaster restart for Alonso who has also lost places to Stroll and Hamilton directly behind him. Alonso's Alpine has huge sidepod damage which may explain his poor pace.
2022-04-24T13:13:52Z: Leclerc already having a look at Norris into Tamburello, but loses a little ground and is now being hounded by Magnussen. Russell is also lurking behind.
2022-04-24T13:13:42Z: At the restart Vettel gets ahead of Alonso for eighth place at the exit of the Tamburello chicane, and then Tsunoda also gets by the Spanish driver a few corners later.
2022-04-24T13:13:09Z: We're back under way, and Verstappen kicks us back off for lap 5.
2022-04-24T13:12:09Z: TV replays have shown what happened to Schumacher to lose all those places, he got on the kerbs as the pack bunched around the Sainz vs Ricciardo clash and was pushed into a half-spin after minor contact with Alonso.
2022-04-24T13:10:04Z: The safety car is in this lap.
2022-04-24T13:09:08Z: Ricciardo pits for fresh intermediate tyres with nothing to lose already running in last place and under safety car conditions.
2022-04-24T13:08:44Z: No further investigation for the lap 1 contact between Ricciardo and Sainz - stewards declare it a racing incident.
2022-04-24T13:08:00Z: Schumacher was another big loser in that start dropping down to 17th place, with only Zhou and Ricciardo behind him. Sainz is out of his Ferrari and out of this race.
2022-04-24T13:07:53Z: Ricciardo tagged Sainz to take the Ferrari into the gravel, with Bottas touching the rear of the McLaren in that fracas. A difficult one to unpick, that.
2022-04-24T13:05:50Z: Magnussen has charged up to fifth too - and we've got a safety car for Sainz, who's beached in the gravel yet again!
2022-04-24T13:05:17Z: In all that mess at the start Russell has profited massively to move up to sixth place having started 11th - getting by Bottas, Alonso and Schumacher after the tangle between Sainz and Ricciardo.
2022-04-24T13:04:44Z: Verstappen has a very good start, but Leclerc doesn't! Perez and Norris trickle past the Ferrari, as Ricciardo and Sainz tangle - leaving Sainz in the gravel at the first chicane!
2022-04-24T13:03:47Z: And the 2022 Emilia Romagna Grand Prix is under way!
2022-04-24T13:00:05Z: The formation lap hath commenced. Keep it clean, chaps.
2022-04-24T12:58:55Z: Still damp conditions on what Nadine Dorries would describe as an F1 pitch, so make sure you're downstreaming the race as it's sure to be as exciting as a lockdown party.
2022-04-24T12:55:58Z: Some notices for y'all: everyone's starting this race on the intermediate tyre. There's also a 60% chance of rain over the grand prix.
2022-04-24T12:54:06Z: The Aston Martin safety car - Max Verstappen's favourite foe - has made a plethora of appearances this weekend. There's a chance we'll get more this afternoon.
2022-04-24T12:50:43Z: 10 minutes to go, folks. Are we ready?
2022-04-24T12:50:29Z: The Italian flag plumes over the start-finish straight in an aerobatic fly-by. Glad to see F1 is committed to a green future.
2022-04-24T12:43:33Z: Russell starts 11th from Tsunoda, Vettel, Hamilton, Stroll, Ocon, Gasly, Albon and Latifi - with Zhou starting from the pitlane after his sprint crash with Gasly.
2022-04-24T12:42:33Z: Let's have a reminder of the grid: Verstappen starts from pole, from Leclerc, Perez, Sainz, Norris, Ricciardo, Bottas, Magnussen, Alonso and Schumacher completing the top 10.
2022-04-24T12:38:00Z: Just over 20 minutes until we get going. The big choice among the teams is whether to start on intermediate tyres or the full wet. As the rain appears to have stopped, it'll likely be the green-walled inter. We shall see.
2022-04-24T12:30:12Z: With a wet circuit, who can make a splash at Imola? Will Leclerc continue to reign in 2022, or can Verstappen pour water on Ferrari's hopes in Italy? It'll all come out in the wash.
2022-04-24T12:18:14Z: It's been a real smorgasbord of racing in the world this weekend: WRC has just finished up, MotoGP is currently on now, there's two more BTCC races to come this afternoon - and that's still not all.
2022-04-24T12:09:48Z: Yesterday, we had a pretty big battle for the lead to enjoy, featuring usual suspects Max Verstappen and Charles Leclerc. With rain potentially a factor here, will we get different contenders?
2022-04-24T12:01:15Z: Hello everybody, and welcome to our Autosport Live updates, build-up and commentary for F1's Emilia Romagna Grand Prix. Just an hour to go until lights out, so grab your snacks and book your spot on the sofa.
